block.p: Elizabeth Mayer, the daughter of Joan and Harold C. Mayer Jr. of New York, was married last evening to Howard Steven Rappaport, a son of Frances Rappaport of Woodbridge, Conn., and the late Harvey Rappaport. Dr. Ronald B. Sobel, the senior rabbi at Congregation Emanu-El in New York, officiated at the Sunningdale Country Club in Scarsdale, N.Y.

Mrs. Rappaport, 34, is a learning specialist at the Dalton School in New York, where she teaches elementary-school reading and mathematics. A graduate of Vassar College, she received a master's degree in elementary education and a post-master's degree in reading from the Bank Street College of Education. Her father is a stockbroker with Oscar Gruss & Son, an investment bank in New York.

Sobel, the senior rabbi at Congregation Emanu-El in New York, officiated at the Sunningdale Country Club in Scarsdale, N.Y.

Mrs. Rappaport, 34, is a learning specialist at the Dalton School in New York, where she teaches elementary-school reading and mathematics. A graduate of Vassar College, she received a master's degree in elementary education and a post-master's degree in reading from the Bank Street College of Education. Her father is a stockbroker with Oscar Gruss & Son, an investment bank in New York.
The bride's grandfather, the late Harold C. Mayer, was a founder of Bear, Stearns & Company, the investment bank.

Mr. Rappaport, 37, is a vice president for real estate development at Continental Developers in Woodbridge, N.J. He graduated cum laude from Columbia University and received a law degree from New York University. His father was the president of HJR Enterprises, a company that imported apparel and souvenirs in New Haven.
